com.example.rest

Class PersonRest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.rest.PersonRest

  • @Path(value="/person")
public class PersonRest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will respond to request involved in handling information of a single person or multiple phone numbers (numbers are child elements of the person). The url path to this REST API is:
    http://localhost:8080/jeer/rest/person
    To handle operations per phone number, use PhoneNumberRest.

      Response addPerson(javax.json.JsonObject obj)
      This will respond to POST request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".

      Response deletePerson(java.lang.String personId)
      This will respond to DELETE request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".
      Finds a single person with the given id and if found, removes it from the database.

      This will respond to GET request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".
      Gets a single person with all necessary details if the person with the given id exists in the database.

    • Method Detail

      • getPerson

        @GET
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public Response getPerson(@QueryParam(value="personId")
                                       java.lang.String personId,
                                       @QueryParam(value="phoneNumbers")
                                       java.lang.String phoneNumbers)
        This will respond to GET request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".
        Gets a single person with all necessary details if the person with the given id exists in the database. If the id is less than zero (< 0), an empty person is returned simply providing the json structure used.
        Parameters:
        personId - The id of the person to get. Use negative value to get empty structure
        Returns:
        A Response object, having the person data as a 'payload'

      • addPerson

        @POST
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public Response addPerson(javax.json.JsonObject obj)
        This will respond to POST request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".
        Will create a new person in database.
        Parameters:
        obj - A json object containing all the information needed to create a new person. The structure should be equal received with 'getPerson'. Note: You do not have to (or should) use json to parse the values from and to populate the entity. See PhoneNumberRest.addPhoneNumber(PhoneNumber, String) how you really should do this
        Returns:
        A Response object stating how things went
        See Also:
        #getPerson(String), PhoneNumberRest.addPhoneNumber(PhoneNumber, String)

      • deletePerson

        @DELETE
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public Response deletePerson(@QueryParam(value="personId")
                                             java.lang.String personId)
        This will respond to DELETE request with dataType : 'json' & "Content-Type" : "application/json".
        Finds a single person with the given id and if found, removes it from the database.
        Parameters:
        personId - The id of the person to remove
        Returns:
        A Response object stating how things went
        See Also:
        Response
